page.title: 14ROYAL & ANCIENT GOLF CLUB
page.content: The Society of St.Andrews Golfers was formed in 1754 and in 1834, under the patronage of William IV, became the Royal & Ancient Golf Club. It has a total of 1800 members, of whom 1050 are resident in Britain and Ireland and 750 are overseas. No women are eligible for membership. The Club has also been recognised as the governing authority on the rules of golf since 1897, except in the USA where the USGA presides.The Captain of the Club is chosen by past captains and holds office for one year. There are 16 full-time staff, headed by the Secretary, Michael Bonnaleck. There are 7 committees covering the various functions of the Club. INTERNATIONAL: Rules of Golf; Implements and Balls; Amateur Status. NATIONAL: Championship; Selection. CLUB: Finance; General.
